title: [Large-Scale] Introductory Course on Statistics and Research Design for Medical Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic statistical terminology and ability to read research papers
context.additional_context: Customized education for healthcare professionals conducted in a non-face-to-face learning environment using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can write a data analysis plan applying basic statistical methodologies (e.g., t-tests, chi-square tests) for research design.
Learners can analyze clinical research cases and propose appropriate sample size calculations and interpretation strategies for results.
Learners can visualize descriptive and inferential statistics using analysis tools like SPSS/R and compile them into a report.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
